subject: Art
title: Color Keys
description: High-key and low-key palettes set the overall mood of your artwork.

hook.text: A piece of music can be in a major key (bright, happy) or a minor key (dark, somber). Color has keys too â€” and they set the emotional tone of your entire painting.

buildup.text: High-key: mostly light values â€” airy, bright, optimistic. Low-key: mostly dark values â€” moody, dramatic, mysterious. Mid-key: centered values â€” neutral, balanced, everyday.

discovery.text: Choose your key before painting. A beach scene works as high-key (bright sunlight). A candlelit dinner works as low-key (deep shadows). Matching key to subject creates emotional resonance.

twist.text: Contrast within the key creates the drama. In a low-key painting, one bright highlight is electrifying. In a high-key painting, one deep shadow grounds everything. The exception proves the rule.

climax.text: Rembrandt: low-key master. Monet: high-key master. Both legendary. The choice of key is neither right nor wrong â€” it's about what story you want to tell.

punchline.text: High-key = light and airy. Low-key = dark and dramatic. Set the mood before you mix a single color.
